name: Mr. Mime

abilities.name: Invisible Wall
abilities.text: Whenever an attack (including your own) does 30 or more damage to Mr. Mime (after applying Weakness and Resistance), prevent that damage. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.) This power can't be used if Mr. Mime is Asleep, Confused, or Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Meditate
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pok√©mon.

flavorText: If interrupted while miming, it will slap around the enemy with its broad hands.

strengths: Invisible Wall prevents all attacks dealing 30+ damage
Completely shuts down heavy hitters like Scyther, Mewtwo, Charizard
Meditate can scale damage against wounded Pokemon
Psychic weakness is mitigated by Invisible Wall (Psychic attacks must deal exactly 10-15 base damage to hit)
weaknesses: Only 40 HP - vulnerable to attacks dealing under 30 damage
Can be worn down by small attacks (Lickitung's Tongue Wrap, etc.)
Your own attacks can be blocked if dealing 30+ to Mr. Mime
synergies: Alakazam - Damage Swap moves damage counters off Mr. Mime
Pokemon Center - heal the small damage that gets through
Scoop Up - pick up damaged Mr. Mime
Full Heal/Trainer cards - remove status conditions
counters: Lickitung - Tongue Wrap does only 10 damage
Attacks dealing less than 30 damage after calculations
Status condition inflicting attacks - disable Invisible Wall

competitiveHistory: Mr. Mime from Jungle was one of the most iconic and competitively significant cards from the set. Its Invisible Wall Pokemon Power completely invalidated heavy hitters, making it a cornerstone of stall and control strategies. The famous 'Mr. Mime/Alakazam' deck used Damage Swap to move the small amounts of damage off Mr. Mime to tanky benched Pokemon. Mr. Mime was a meta-defining card that forced opponents to include answers for it, and it remained relevant throughout the Base Set era. It was particularly effective against Haymaker's big attackers like Hitmonchan and Electabuzz.

rulings.ruling: Invisible Wall only prevents damage, not the placement of damage counters from effects. Attacks that place damage counters (like Sabrina's Golduck) bypass Invisible Wall.
Damage calculation happens after applying Weakness and Resistance. A Psychic attack dealing 15 base damage would deal 30 after Weakness, which IS blocked by Invisible Wall.
Swift-type attacks that ignore Pokemon Powers bypass Invisible Wall regardless of damage amount.
All Special Conditions (Asleep, Confused, Paralyzed, Poisoned, Burned) disable Invisible Wall.
Invisible Wall blocks damage from your own attacks as well if they would deal 30+ to Mr. Mime.
Rainbow Energy's 10 damage when attached is not prevented by Invisible Wall as it is not from an attack.
Damage moved by Pokemon Powers like Damage Swap is not blocked by Invisible Wall.
